Levari Facias.definition: a common-law writ of execution for the satisfaction of a judgment debt from the goods and lands of the judgment debtor used chiefly in Delaware compare fieri facias
Levari Facias.origin: [New Latin, you should cause to be levied]

1.1: a common-law writ of execution for the satisfaction of a judgment debt from the goods and lands of the judgment debtor used chiefly in Delaware compare
